results.title: Understanding different speech types. Part 2
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speaking with confidence”.
This tape covers the different speech types of the procedure, the discussion, the exposition and the response. A sheet providing suggested exercises as well as a speaking checklist (covering areas such as was the talk clear, purpose defined, speech rate and clarity etc) accompanies the video. Presented by Brian Tickle.

results.title: Getting started
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speaking with confidence”.
‘Getting started’ covers the important speech preparation and presentation areas of researching, speech structure, rehearsal, delivery, dress, presentation and the conclusion. A sheet providing suggested exercises as well as a speaking checklist (covering areas such as was the talk clear, purpose defined, speech rate and clarity etc) accompanies the video. Presented by Brian Tickle.

results.title: Audience contact
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speaking with confidence”.
This program in the ‘Speaking with confidence’ series covers the areas of eye contact, gesture, use of notes and lectern, as well as body movement. A sheet providing summary notes, suggested exercises, as well as a speaking checklist (covering areas such as was the talk clear, purpose defined, speech rate and clarity etc) accompanies the video. Presented by Brian Tickle.

results.title: Ingredients of an effective speech
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Speaking with confidence”.
‘Ingredients of a speech’ addresses speaking rate, volume, voice projection, use of light and shade and the use of pausing for delivering an effective speech.

results.title: Wonders sacred and mysterious
results.creator_credit: Marianne Gammon and Reader's Digest Association
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great wonders of the world”.
Monuments of astonishing beauty and power such as Stonehenge, The Great Pyramids at Giza, Hagia Sophia in Istanbul, Borobudur in Java, St Peter’s Basilica in the Vatican City, and the Taj Mahal in Agra are all supreme examples of the human need to try and explain some of the mysteries of life, and the subject of this fascinating Reader’s Digest documentary.

results.title: Wonders of nature
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great wonders of the world”.
All nature’s miracles evoke a sense of wonder but in some places nature reveals her magnificence in very special ways. Witness the majesty of the following places: The Grand Canyon - Arizona, USA ; The Serengeti - Kenya/Tanzania, Africa ; The Sahara Desert - Niger, West Africa ; Iguazu Falls - Argentina/Brazil, South America ; The Amazon River - Brazil, South America ; Ayers Rock (Uluru) - Australia ; The Himalayas - Nepal, Asia.

results.title: Wonders of man's creations
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Great wonders of the world”.
When the urge to build conspires with a vision of beauty, man sometimes leaves behind an enduring mark. The following man-made marks are visited in this informative video: The Colosseum (Rome) ; Machu Pichu (Peru, South America) ; The Great Wall (China) ; The Kremlin (Russia) ; Versailles (France) ; The Statue of Liberty (New York city, USA) ; The Eiffel Tower (France) ; Mount Rushmore National Monument and Crazy Horse Monument (South Dakota, USA).
